english: fragrant; smell (orig. bowl on a stand)

etymology.description: Pictogram: a bowl of rice on a stand; part of the radical 食; unrelated to 良 and 旨.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a rice bowl set on a stand, an early food-related image that later associated with smell and fragrance in usage. Also serves historically as a component within the food radical 食, without any etymological link to 良 or 旨 despite visual resemblance.

examples.chinese: 此酒甚皀，香气四溢(此酒甚皀，香氣四溢)。
examples.pinyin: Cǐ jiǔ shèn jí, xiāngqì sìyì.
examples.english: This wine is very fragrant, and its aroma spreads everywhere.

examples.chinese: 花开时院中皆皀(花開時院中皆皀)。
examples.pinyin: Huā kāi shí yuàn zhōng jiē jí.
examples.english: When the flowers bloom, the courtyard is filled with fragrance.

examples.chinese: 皀字本为象形，像托座上的饭碗(皀字本為象形，像托座上的飯碗)。
examples.pinyin: Jí zì běn wéi xiàngxíng, xiàng tuōzuò shàng de fànwǎn.
examples.english: The graph was originally pictographic, resembling a rice bowl on a stand.
